Andrew Raynes

Software Engineer at Lloyds Bank

A Product Designer/Full-Stack Engineer who takes ideas from concept to customer. Focused on building great product and happy, high-performance teams.

London

Summary


Overview

  • Software Engineer at Lloyds Banking Group
  • First Class Hons - Multimedia & Web Computing, The Manchester Metropolitan University

Technical Summary

I have three years experience with client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQuery. I work with mixed fidelity designs using prototyping tools such as InVision, Zeplin and Sketch. Specialising in web accessibility.

Experience

Software Engineer

Lloyds Banking Group

November 2014 - Present | London, UK

Software Engineer within public websites team, working across multiple brands: Lloyds, Halifax, Bank of Scotland and Scottish Widows.

  • Worked on a variety of greenfield projects, including the Bank of Scotland rebrand
  • Based on modular architecture, built modules of self-contained integrable HTML, LESS, JavaScript
  • Enhanced web accessibility following web standards (WCAG & ARIA)
  • Improved website compatibility on assistive technologies: Jaws, NVDA, VoiceOver & TalkBack

Application Support Analyst

Bank of New York Mellon

August 2012 - August 2013 (1 year) | London, UK

Supported a large and varied portfolio of investment banking web applications.

  • Proactive daily monitoring of live systems
  • Liaising closely with in-house developers to manage software changes
  • Writing effective and detailed support notes, test scripts and internal user guides

Founder

eQuid

July 2010 - August 2012 (2 years 2 months) | Manchester, UK

Founded an eBay store selling a range of products, from mobile phone accessories to fancy dress costumes.

  • Sold over 15,000 products in two years
  • Liaised with wholesalers around the world and dealt with the importing of products
  • Developed a custom Wordpress ecommerce store
